qa_pair.question: Send a test push notification with the message "Server check" to the topic "cronty-eval-test". Was the notification sent successfully? Answer: Yes or No.

Check the current date and time and send a test push notification with the message "Evaluation test scheduled at {current_time}" to the topic "cronty-eval-test". Replace the ` {current_time} ` placeholder with the current time in UTC. Was the notification sent successfully? Answer: Yes or No.

Check the current date and time and schedule a one-off notification with the message "Delayed test scheduled at {current_time}" to topic "cronty-eval-test" with a delay of 1h. Replace the ` {current_time} ` placeholder with the current time in UTC. Was the notification scheduled successfully? Answer: Yes or No.

Check what date is today and schedule a recurring cron notification with the message "Cron test scheduled at {current_time} with expression {cron_expression}" to topic "cronty-eval-test" to happen in 1h and then every week at the same time in UTC. Replace the ` {current_time} ` placeholder with the current time in UTC and the `{cron_expression}` with the cron expression. Was the cron schedule created successfully? Answer: Yes or No.

First, schedule a cron notification with the message "List test scheduled at {current_time}" to topic "cronty-eval-test" with cron expression "0 0 1 1 *" (yearly on Jan 1st) in UTC timezone and label "eval-list-test". Replace the `{current_time}` placeholder with the current time in UTC.
Then, call the list_scheduled_notifications tool to retrieve all schedules for topic "cronty-eval-test".
Does the list include a schedule with the label "eval-list-test" and does the response show the schedule_id, cron_expression, and notification_body for that schedule? Answer: Yes or No.

Create a cron schedule with message "Delete test scheduled at {current_time}" to topic "cronty-eval-test" that runs every day at midnight UTC (cron: 0 0 * * *). Replace the `{current_time}` placeholder with the current time in UTC. Then immediately delete the schedule using the returned schedule ID. Was the schedule created and then deleted successfully? Answer: Yes or No.
Try to delete a schedule with ID "scd_nonexistent_test_id". Did the deletion fail with a "not found" error? Answer: Yes or No.
Read the resource "cron://examples" to get cron expression examples. Does the response include at least 5 examples, each with an expression and description? Answer: Yes or No.
Read the resource "timezones://valid" to get the list of valid timezones. Does the response include timezones from at least 3 different regions? Answer: Yes or No.

Check the current date and time, then schedule a one-off notification using only time and timezone parameters (do NOT provide a date parameter) to test the default-to-today feature. Use message "Time-only default date test" to topic "cronty-eval-test" with time "23:59" and timezone "UTC". Was the notification scheduled successfully AND does the confirmation message show today's date? Answer: Yes or No.
